==Character history==
==Character history==
â
Jonny first appears in February 2007 when he strikes up a friendly working relationship with [[bisexual]] [[Grayson Sinclair]]. Grayson's wife, [[Perdita Hyde-Sinclair|Perdy]], soon starts to think they are having affair. She then sets up a business dinner and invites her gay friend Paul Lambert, hoping they get together. This works, and the eventually go on a date. After six months together, Jonny moves into [[List of residences in Emmerdale#Victora Cottage|Victoria Cottage]] with Paul, Paul's father [[Rodney Blackstock]] and [[Emily Kirk]]. He confides in Paul that as a teenager he suffered from an eating disorder as a result of loneliness and unhappiness. During his time in Emmerdale, Jonny sets up an aerobics dance class and a fitness club.
+
Jonny first appears in February 2007 when he strikes up a friendly working relationship with [[bisexual]] [[Grayson Sinclair]]. Grayson's wife, [[Perdita Hyde-Sinclair|Perdy]], soon starts to think they are having affair. She then sets up a business dinner and invites her gay friend Paul Lambert, hoping they get together. This works, and the eventually go on a date. After six months together, Jonny moves into Victoria Cottage with Paul, Paul's father [[Rodney Blackstock]] and [[Emily Kirk]]. He confides in Paul that as a teenager he suffered from an eating disorder as a result of loneliness and unhappiness. During his time in Emmerdale, Jonny sets up an aerobics dance class and a fitness club.
When Grayson and Perdy have difficulties in their relationship â caused by his mother [[Rosemary King|Rosemary]] â she is sectioned, and Paul spends more time with Grayson as he acts a go between the two. Paul develops feelings for Grayson, and Jonny asks Paul to marry him. Paul accepts, but during their engagement he has a one-night stand with Grayson. When Grayson tells Paul it meant nothing to him, Paul feels guilty and tells Jonny. He manages to persuade Jonny not to leave Emmerdale and on 3 March 2008 they have their [[Civil partnership in the United Kingdom|civil partnership]] at Hotten Registry Office. Later that day they have a ceremony at Home Farm, as neither can tell their parents they have already legally married.
When Grayson and Perdy have difficulties in their relationship â caused by his mother [[Rosemary King|Rosemary]] â she is sectioned, and Paul spends more time with Grayson as he acts a go between the two. Paul develops feelings for Grayson, and Jonny asks Paul to marry him. Paul accepts, but during their engagement he has a one-night stand with Grayson. When Grayson tells Paul it meant nothing to him, Paul feels guilty and tells Jonny. He manages to persuade Jonny not to leave Emmerdale and on 3 March 2008 they have their [[Civil partnership in the United Kingdom|civil partnership]] at Hotten Registry Office. Later that day they have a ceremony at Home Farm, as neither can tell their parents they have already legally married.
